comment.body: You're more than strong enough. You will ace it. You will succeed.

> [yinyue](#comment_5_1GNgaj5EqkzqYECYbXa889fGLyuseHRi3t): Be care for. The peer to peer project's DEV is killed

Oh boy. Global elite didn't like him. I'm now worried for Nofish, kind of have been before, but this solidifies my fear.

Perhaps he left everything at home to avoid ICE bullshit.

Also, I've heard that Samuel having arms in Canada was a death sentence waiting to happen.

We should probably chill out and be patient. He's busy in the US ATM.

> [nofish](#comment_290_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): Thanks for reporting, fixed!

ZeroUpdate worked as a downgrade path while this was going on. You should provide a downgrade option. I can't move my ZeroNet dlrectory on a phone and this bug made it much easier if I ever needed to downgrade.

Big files don't resume downloading in any recent revision of ZeroNet since a long time ago.

We want big file downloads to resume.

Background (browser window closed) downloading and seeding should be enabled by default.

I and everyone else has issues with this. A lot of big files don't download in their entirety. On any internet connection that momentarily drops out, this is a major issue, on top of the fact that nobody will keep a browser open 24/7, which is understandable. Who would?
I need to be able to click **This is My Site** on Android. Please fix this.

> [leftside](#comment_19_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): How can I block zeronet.py from reaching the internet?For example, internet connection is OK that the normal browsers can open the google.com, etc. At this point, is there any way for zeronet.py not to reach the outside world while it's running?

Are you wanting subnet routing to still work while offline? Ask this developer: https://github.com/M66B/NetGuard/blob/master/FAQ.md

I know it's Android-only, but I hope it helps.
Could this be why videos went missing before? I was wondering, because I have to redownload one of them tonight. Not updated to Rev3660 yet.
ZeroMe's dark theme is freaking gorgeous!

I'm thinking of the versioning feature extending to "favicon":

Though, I know that would be of very little importance, if any.
Does this mean updates are P2P without ZeroUp now?
Is there a way to make ZeroNet-Kivy run without the window open?
Could you also make the ZH File checkbox selection area wider? It's tall rectangular at the moment when I know you meant it to be square.
